tables.table_schema:
CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    date DATE,
    time TIME,
    energy_usage FLOAT,
    location VARCHAR(255)
);

CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
    consumption_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    meter_id INT,
    date TIMESTAMP,
    usage DECIMAL,
    FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES smart_meters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE smart_meters (
    meter_id INT PRIMARY KEY,
    location VARCHAR(255),
    installation_date DATE
)

CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
    meter_id INT,
    timestamp TIMESTAMP,
    energy_reading DECIMAL,
    FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES smart_meters(meter_id)
)

CREATE TABLE meter_readings (
    meter_id INT,
    reading_time TIMESTAMP,
    reading DECIMAL,
    FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES smart_meters(meter_id)
)

CREATE TABLE energy_consumption (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  meter_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  energy_reading DECIMAL,
  FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES smart_meters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE usage_patterns (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  meter_id INT,
  day_of_week VARCHAR(10),
  energy_consumed DECIMAL,
  FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES smart_meters(meter_id)
);

CREATE TABLE anomalies (
  id INT PRIMARY KEY,
  meter_id INT,
  timestamp TIMESTAMP,
  anomaly_type VARCHAR(50),
  description TEXT,
  FOREIGN KEY (meter_id) REFERENCES smart_meters(meter_id)
);
